Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:42: And have created for them of the like thereof whereon they ride.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:43: And if We will, We drown them, and there is no help for them, neither can they be saved;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:44: Unless by mercy from Us and as comfort for a while.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:45: When it is said unto them: Beware of that which is before you and that which is behind you, that haply ye may find mercy (they are heedless).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:46: Never came a token of the tokens of their Lord to them, but they did turn away from it!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:47: And when it is said unto them: Spend of that wherewith Allah hath provided you, those who disbelieve say unto those who believe: Shall we feed those whom Allah, if He willed, would feed ? Ye are in naught else than error manifest.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:48: And they say: When will this promise be fulfilled, if ye are truthful ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:49: They await but one Shout, which will surprise them while they are disputing.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:50: Then they cannot make bequest, nor can they return to their own folk.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:51: And the trumpet is blown and lo! from the graves they hie unto their Lord,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:52: Crying: Woe upon us! Who hath raised us from our place of sleep ? This is that which the Beneficent did promise, and the messengers spoke truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:53: It is but one Shout, and behold them brought together before Us!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:54: This day no soul is wronged in aught; nor are ye requited aught save what ye used to do.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:55: Lo! those who merit paradise this day are happily employed,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:56: They and their wives, in pleasant shade, on thrones reclining;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:57: Theirs the fruit (of their good deeds) and theirs (all) that they ask;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:58: The word from a Merciful Lord (for them) is: Peace!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:59: But avaunt ye, O ye guilty, this day!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:60: Did I not charge you, O ye sons of Adam, that ye worship not the devil - Lo! he is your open foe! -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:61: But that ye worship Me ? That was the right path.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:62: Yet he hath led astray of you a great multitude. Had ye then no sense ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:63: This is hell which ye were promised (if ye followed him).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:64: Burn therein this day for that ye disbelieved.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:65: This day We seal up their mouths, and their hands speak out to Us and their feet bear witness as to what they used to earn.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:66: And had We willed, We verily could have quenched their eyesight so that they should struggle for the way. Then how could they have seen ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:67: And had We willed, We verily could have fixed them in their place, making them powerless to go forward or turn back.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:68: He whom we bring unto old age, We reverse him in creation (making him go back to weakness after strength). Have ye then no sense ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:69: And We have not taught him (Muhammad) poetry, nor is it meet for him. This is naught else than a Reminder and a Lecture making plain,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:70: To warn whosoever liveth, and that the word may be fulfilled against the disbelievers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:71: Have they not seen how We have created for them of Our handiwork the cattle, so that they are their owners,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:72: And have subdued them unto them, so that some of them they have for riding, some for food ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:73: Benefits and (divers) drinks have they from them. Will they not then give thanks ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:74: And they have taken (other) gods beside Allah, in order that they may be helped.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:75: It is not in their power to help them; but they (the worshippers) are unto them a host in arms.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:76: So let not their speech grieve thee (O Muhammad). Lo! We know what they conceal and what proclaim.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:77: Hath not man seen that We have created him from a drop of seed ? Yet lo! he is an open opponent.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:78: And he hath coined for Us a similitude, and hath forgotten the fact of his creation, saying: Who will revive these bones when they have rotted away ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:79: Say: He will revive them Who produced them at the first, for He is Knower of every creation,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:80: Who hath appointed for you fire from the green tree, and behold! ye kindle from it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:81: Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the like of them ? Aye, that He is! for He is the All-Wise Creator,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:82: But His command, when He intendeth a thing, is only that He saith unto it: Be! and it is.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 36:83: Therefor Glory be to Him in Whose hand is the dominion over all things! Unto Him ye will be brought back.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:2: By the Qur’an, full of Wisdom,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:3: Thou art indeed one of the apostles,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:5: It is a Revelation sent down by (Him), the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:6: In order that thou mayest admonish a people, whose fathers had received no admonition, and who therefore remain heedless (of the Signs of God).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:7: The Word is proved true against the greater part of them: for they do not believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:8: We have put yokes round their necks right up to their chins, so that their heads are forced up (and they cannot see).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:9: And We have put a bar in front of them and a bar behind them, and further, We have covered them up; so that they cannot see.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:10: The same is it to them whether thou admonish them or thou do not admonish them: they will not believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:11: Thou canst but admonish such a one as follows the Message and fears the (Lord) Most Gracious, unseen: give such a one, therefore, good tidings, of Forgiveness and a Reward most generous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:12: Verily We shall give life to the dead, and We record that which they send before and that which they leave behind, and of all things have We taken account in a clear Book (of evidence).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:13: Set forth to them, by way of a parable, the (story of) the Companions of the City. Behold!, there came apostles to it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:14: When We (first) sent to them two apostles, they rejected them: But We strengthened them with a third: they said, "Truly, we have been sent on a mission to you."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:15: The (people) said: "Ye are only men like ourselves; and (God) Most Gracious sends no sort of revelation: ye do nothing but lie."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:16: They said: "Our Lord doth know that we have been sent on a mission to you:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:17: "And our duty is only to proclaim the clear Message."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:18: The (people) said: "for us, we augur an evil omen from you: if ye desist not, we will certainly stone you. And a grievous punishment indeed will be inflicted on you by us."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:19: They said: "Your evil omens are with yourselves: (deem ye this an evil omen). If ye are admonished? Nay, but ye are a people transgressing all bounds!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:20: Then there came running, from the farthest part of the City, a man, saying, "O my people! Obey the apostles:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:21: "Obey those who ask no reward of you (for themselves), and who have themselves received Guidance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:22: "It would not be reasonable in me if I did not serve Him Who created me, and to Whom ye shall (all) be brought back.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:23: "Shall I take (other) gods besides Him? If (God) Most Gracious should intend some adversity for me, of no use whatever will be their intercession for me, nor can they deliver me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:24: "I would indeed, if I were to do so, be in manifest Error.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:25: "For me, I have faith in the Lord of you (all): listen, then, to me!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:26: It was said: "Enter thou the Garden." He said: "Ah me! Would that my People knew (what I know)!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:27: "For that my Lord has granted me Forgiveness and has enrolled me among those held in honour!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:28: And We sent not down against his People, after him, any hosts from heaven, nor was it needful for Us so to do.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:29: It was no more than a single mighty Blast, and behold! they were (like ashes) quenched and silent.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:30: Ah! Alas for (My) Servants! There comes not an apostle to them but they mock him!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:31: See they not how many generations before them we destroyed? Not to them will they return:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:32: But each one of them all - will be brought before Us (for judgment).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:33: A Sign for them is the earth that is dead: We do give it life, and produce grain therefrom, of which ye do eat.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:34: And We produce therein orchard with date-palms and vines, and We cause springs to gush forth therein:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:35: That they may enjoy the fruits of this (artistry): It was not their hands that made this: will they not then give thanks?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:36: Glory to God, Who created in pairs all things that the earth produces, as well as their own (human) kind and (other) things of which they have no knowledge.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:37: And a Sign for them is the Night: We withdraw therefrom the Day, and behold they are plunged in darkness;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:38: And the sun runs his course for a period determined for him: that is the decree of (Him), the Exalted in Might, the All-Knowing.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:39: And the Moon,- We have measured for her mansions (to traverse) till she returns like the old (and withered) lower part of a date-stalk.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:40: It is not permitted to the Sun to catch up the Moon, nor can the Night outstrip the Day: Each (just) swims along in (its own) orbit (according to Law).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:41: And a Sign for them is that We bore their race (through the Flood) in the loaded Ark;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:42: And We have created for them similar (vessels) on which they ride.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:43: If it were Our Will, We could drown them: then would there be no helper (to hear their cry), nor could they be delivered,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:44: Except by way of Mercy from Us, and by way of (world) convenience (to serve them) for a time.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:45: When they are told, "Fear ye that which is before you and that which will be after you, in order that ye may receive Mercy," (they turn back).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:46: Not a Sign comes to them from among the Signs of their Lord, but they turn away therefrom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:47: And when they are told, "Spend ye of (the bounties) with which God has provided you," the Unbelievers say to those who believe: "Shall we then feed those whom, if God had so willed, He would have fed, (Himself)?- Ye are in nothing but manifest error."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:48: Further, they say, "When will this promise (come to pass), if what ye say is true?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:49: They will not (have to) wait for aught but a single Blast: it will seize them while they are yet disputing among themselves!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:50: No (chance) will they then have, by will, to dispose (of their affairs), nor to return to their own people!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:51: The trumpet shall be sounded, when behold! from the sepulchres (men) will rush forth to their Lord!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:52: They will say: "Ah! Woe unto us! Who hath raised us up from our beds of repose?"... (A voice will say:) "This is what (God) Most Gracious had promised. And true was the word of the apostles!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:53: It will be no more than a single Blast, when lo! they will all be brought up before Us!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:54: Then, on that Day, not a soul will be wronged in the least, and ye shall but be repaid the meeds of your past Deeds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:55: Verily the Companions of the Garden shall that Day have joy in all that they do;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:56: They and their associates will be in groves of (cool) shade, reclining on Thrones (of dignity);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:57: (Every) fruit (enjoyment) will be there for them; they shall have whatever they call for;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:58: "Peace!" - a word (of salutation) from a Lord Most Merciful!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:59: "And O ye in sin! Get ye apart this Day!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:60: "Did I not enjoin on you, O ye Children of Adam, that ye should not worship Satan; for that he was to you an enemy avowed?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:61: "And that ye should worship Me, (for that) this was the Straight Way?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:62: "But he did lead astray a great multitude of you. Did ye not, then, understand?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:63: "This is the Hell of which ye were (repeatedly) warned!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:64: "Embrace ye the (fire) this Day, for that ye (persistently) rejected (Truth)."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:65: That Day shall We set a seal on their mouths. But their hands will speak to us, and their feet bear witness, to all that they did.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:66: If it had been our Will, We could surely have blotted out their eyes; then should they have run about groping for the Path, but how could they have seen?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:67: And if it had been Our Will, We could have transformed them (to remain) in their places; then should they have been unable to move about, nor could they have returned (after error).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:68: If We grant long life to any, We cause him to be reversed in nature: Will they not then understand?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:69: We have not instructed the (Prophet) in Poetry, nor is it meet for him: this is no less than a Message and a Qur’an making things clear:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:70: That it may give admonition to any (who are) alive, and that the charge may be proved against those who reject (Truth).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:71: See they not that it is We Who have created for them - among the things which Our hands have fashioned - cattle, which are under their dominion?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:72: And that We have subjected them to their (use)? of them some do carry them and some they eat:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:73: And they have (other) profits from them (besides), and they get (milk) to drink. Will they not then be grateful?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:74: Yet they take (for worship) gods other than God, (hoping) that they might be helped!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:75: They have not the power to help them: but they will be brought up (before Our Judgment-seat) as a troop (to be condemned).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:76: Let not their speech, then, grieve thee. Verily We know what they hide as well as what they disclose.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:77: Doth not man see that it is We Who created him from sperm? yet behold! he (stands forth) as an open adversary!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:78: And he makes comparisons for Us, and forgets his own (origin and) Creation: He says, "Who can give life to (dry) bones and decomposed ones (at that)?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:79: Say, "He will give them life Who created them for the first time! for He is Well-versed in every kind of creation!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:80: "The same Who produces for you fire out of the green tree, when behold! ye kindle therewith (your own fires)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:81: "Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like thereof?" - Yea, indeed! for He is the Creator Supreme, of skill and knowledge (infinite)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:82: Verily, when He intends a thing, His Command is, "be", and it is!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 36:83: So glory to Him in Whose hands is the dominion of all things: and to Him will ye be all brought back.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:3: thou art truly among the Envoys
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:5: the sending down of the All-mighty, the All-wise,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:6: that thou mayest warn a people whose fathers were never warned, so they are heedless.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:7: The Word has been realised against most of them, yet they do not believe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:8: Surely We have put on their necks fetters up to the chin, so their heads are raised;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:9: and We have put before them a barrier and behind them a barrier; and We have covered them, so they do not see.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:10: Alike it is to them whether thou hast warned them or thou hast not warned them, they do not believe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:11: Thou only warnest him who follows the Remembrance and who fears the All-merciful in the Unseen; so give him the good tidings of forgiveness and a generous wage.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:12: Surely it is We who bring the dead to life and write down what they have forwarded and what they have left behind; everything We have numbered in a clear register.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:13: Strike for them a similitude -- the inhabitants of the city, when the Envoys came to it;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:14: when We sent unto them two men, but they cried them lies, so We sent a third as reinforcement. They said, ’We are assuredly Envoys unto you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:15: They said, ’You are naught but mortals like us; the All-merciful has not sent down anything. You are speaking only lies.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:16: They said, ’Our Lord knows we are Envoys unto you;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:17: and it is only for us to deliver the Manifest Message.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:18: They said, ’We augur ill of you. If you give not over, we will stone you and there shall visit you from us a painful chastisement.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:19: They said, ’Your augury is with you; if you are reminded? But you are a prodigal people.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:20: Then came a man from the furthest part of the city, running; he said, ’My people, follow the Envoys!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:21: Follow such as ask no wage of you, that are right-guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:22: And why should I not serve Him who originated me, and unto whom you shall be returned?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:23: What, shall I take, apart from Him, gods whose intercession, if the All-merciful desires affliction for me, shall not avail me anything, and who will never deliver me?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:24: Surely in that case I should be in manifest error.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:25: Behold, I believe in your Lord; therefore hear me!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:26: It was said, ’Enter Paradise!’ He said, ’Ah, would that my people had knowledge
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:27: that my Lord has forgiven me and that He has placed me among the honoured.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:28: And We sent not down upon his people, after him, any host out of heaven; neither would We send any down.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:29: It was only one Cry and lo, they were silent and still.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:30: Ah, woe for those servants! Never comes unto them a Messenger, but they mock at him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:31: What, have they not seen how many generations We have destroyed before them, and that it is not unto them that they return?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:32: They shall every one of them be arraigned before Us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:33: And a sign for them is the dead land, that We quickened and brought forth from it grain, whereof they eat;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:34: and We made therein gardens of palms and vines, and therein We caused fountains to gush forth,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:35: that they might eat of its fruits and their hands’ labour. What, will they not be thankful?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:36: Glory be to Him, who created all the pairs of what the earth produces, and of themselves, and of what they know not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:37: And a sign for them is the night; We strip it of the day and lo, they are in darkness.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:38: And the sun -- it runs to a fixed resting-place; that is the ordaining of the All-mighty, the All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:39: And the moon -- We have determined it by stations, till it returns like an aged palm-bough.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:40: It behoves not the sun to overtake the moon, neither does the night outstrip the day, each swimming in a sky.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:41: And a sign for them is that We carried their seed in the laden ship,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:42: and We have created for them the like of it whereon they ride;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:43: and if We will, We drown them, then none have they to cry to, neither are they delivered,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:44: save as a mercy from Us, and enjoyment for a while.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:45: And when it is said to them, ’Fear what is before you and what is behind you; haply you will find mercy’ --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:46: yet never any sign of the signs of their Lord comes to them, but they are turning away from it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:47: And when it is said to them, ’Expend of that God has provided you,’ the unbelievers say to the believers, ’What, shall we feed such a one whom, if God willed, He would feed? You are only in manifest error!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:48: They also say, ’When shall this promise come to pass, if you speak truly?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:49: They are awaiting only for one Cry to seize them while they are yet disputing,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:50: then they will not be able to make any testament, nor will they return to their people.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:51: And the Trumpet shall be blown; then behold, they are sliding down from their tombs unto their Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:52: They say, ’Alas for us! Who roused us out of our sleeping place? This is what the All-merciful promised, and the Envoys spoke truly.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:53: ’It was only one Cry; then behold, they are all arraigned before Us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:54: So today no soul shall be wronged anything, and you shall not be recompensed, except according to what you have been doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:55: See, the inhabitants of Paradise today are busy in their rejoicing,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:56: they and their spouses, reclining upon couches in the shade;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:57: therein they have fruits, and they have all that they call for.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:58: ’Peace!’ -- such is the greeting, from a Lord All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:59: ’Now keep yourselves apart, you sinners, upon this day!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:60: Made I not covenant with you, Children of Adam, that you should not serve Satan -- surely he is a manifest foe to you --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:61: and that you should serve Me? This is a straight path.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:62: He led astray many a throng of you; did you not understand?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:63: This is Gehenna, then, the same that you were promised;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:64: roast well in it today, for that you were unbelievers!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:65: Today We set a seal on their mouths, and their hands speak to Us, and their feet bear witness as to what they have been earning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:66: Did We will, We would have obliterated their eyes, then they would race to the path, but how would they see?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:67: Did We will, We would have changed them where they were, then they could not go on, nor could they return.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:68: And to whomsoever We give long life, We bend him over in His constitution; what, do they not understand?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:69: We have not taught him poetry; it is not seemly for him. It is only a Remembrance and a Clear Koran,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:70: that he may warn whosoever is living, and that the Word may be realized against the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:71: Have they not seen how that We have created for them of that Our hands wrought cattle that they own?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:72: We have subdued them to them, and some of them they ride, and some they eat;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:73: other uses also they have in them, and beverages. What, will they not be thankful?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:74: Yet they have taken, apart from God, gods; haply they might be helped.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:75: They cannot help them, though they be hosts made ready for them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:76: So do not let their saying grieve thee; assuredly We know what they keep secret and what they publish.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:77: Has not man regarded how that We created him of a sperm-drop? Then lo, he is a manifest adversary.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:78: And he has struck for Us a similitude and forgotten his creation; he says, ’Who shall quicken the bones when they are decayed?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:79: Say: ’He shall quicken them, who originated them the first time; He knows all creation,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:80: who has made for you out of the green tree fire and lo, from it you kindle.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:81: Is not He, who created the heavens and earth, able to create the like of them? Yes indeed; He is the All-creator, the All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:82: His command, when He desires a thing, is to say to it ’Be,’ and it is.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 36:83: So glory be to Him, in whose hand is the dominion of everything, and unto whom you shall be returned.

Muhammad Asad.verse 36:2: Consider this Qur’ān full of wisdom:
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:3: verily, thou art indeed one of God’s message-bearers,
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:5: by [virtue of] what is being bestowed from on high by the Almighty, the Dispenser of Grace,
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:6: [bestowed upon thee] so that thou mayest warn people whose forefathers had not been warned, and who therefore are unaware [of the meaning of right and wrong].
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:7: Indeed, the word [of God’s condemnation] is bound to come true against most of them: for they will not believe.
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:8: Behold, around their necks We have put shackles, reaching up to their chins, so that their heads are forced up;
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:9: and We have set a barrier before them and a barrier behind them, and We have enshrouded them in veils so that they cannot see:
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:10: thus, it is all one to them whether thou warnest them or dost not warn them: they will not believe.
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:11: Thou canst [truly] warn only him who is willing to take the reminder to heart, and who stands in awe of the Most Gracious although He is beyond the reach of human perception: unto such, then, give the glad tiding of [God’s] forgiveness and of a most excellent reward!
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:12: Verily, We shall indeed bring the dead back to life; and We shall record whatever [deeds] they have sent ahead, and the traces [of good and evil] which they have left behind: for of all things do We take account in a record clear.
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:13: AND SET FORTH unto them a parable – [the story of how] the people of a township [behaved] when [Our] message-bearers came unto them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:14: Lo! We sent unto them two [apostles], and they gave the lie to both; and so We strengthened [the two] with a third; and thereupon they said: "Behold, we have been sent unto you [by God]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:15: [The others] answered: "You are nothing but mortal men like ourselves; moreover, the Most Gracious has never bestowed aught [of revelation] from on high. You do nothing but lie!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:16: Said [the apostles]: "Our Sustainer knows that we have indeed been sent unto you;
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:17: but we are not bound to do more than clearly deliver the message [entrusted to us]."
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:18: Said [the others]: "Truly, we augur evil from you! Indeed, if you desist not, we will surely stone you, and grievous suffering is bound to befall you at our hands!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:19: [The apostles] replied: "Your destiny, good or evil, is [bound up] with yourselves! [Does it seem evil to you] if you are told to take [the truth] to heart? Nay, but you are people who have wasted their own selves!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:20: At that, a man came running from the farthest end of the city, [and] exclaimed: "O my people! Follow these message-bearers!
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:21: Follow those who ask no reward of you, and themselves are rightly guided!
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:22: "[As for me,] why should I not worship Him who has brought me into being, and to whom you all will be brought back?
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:23: Should I take to worshipping [other] deities beside Him? [But then,] if the Most Gracious should will that harm befall me, their intercession could not in the least avail me, nor could they save me:
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:24: and so, behold, I would have indeed, most obviously, lost myself in error!
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:25: "Verily, [O my people,] in the Sustainer of you all have I come to believe: listen, then, to me!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:26: [And] he was told, "[Thou shalt] enter paradise!" – [whereupon] he exclaimed: "Would that my people knew
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:27: how my Sustainer has forgiven me [the sins of my past], and has placed me among the honoured ones!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:28: And after that, no host out of heaven did We send down against his people, nor did We need to send down any:
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:29: nothing was [needed] but one single blast [of Our punishment] – and lo! they became as still and silent as ashes.
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:30: OH, THE REGRETS that [most] human beings will have to bear! Never has an apostle come to them without their deriding him!
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:31: Are they not aware of how many a generation We have destroyed before their time, [and] that those [that have perished] will never return to them,
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:32: and [that] all of them, all together, will [in the end] before Us be arraigned?
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:33: And [yet,] they have a sign [of Our power to create and to resurrect] in the lifeless earth which We make alive, and out of which We bring forth grain, whereof they may eat;
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:34: and [how] We make gardens of date-palms and vines [grow] thereon, and cause springs to gush [forth] within it,
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:35: so that they may eat of the fruit thereof, though it was not their hands that made it. Will they not, then, be grateful?
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:36: Limitless in His glory is He who has created opposites in whatever the earth produces, and in men’s own selves, and in that of which [as yet] they have no knowledge.
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:37: And [of Our sway over all that exists] they have a sign in the night: We withdraw from it the [light of] day – and lo! they are in darkness.
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:38: And [they have a sign in] the sun: it runs in an orbit of its own – [and] that is laid down by the will of the Almighty, the All-Knowing;
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:39: and [in] the moon, for which We have determined phases [which it must traverse] till it becomes like an old date-stalk, dried-up and curved:
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:40: [and] neither may the sun overtake the moon, nor can the night usurp the time of day, since all of them float through space [in accordance with Our laws].
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:41: And [it ought to be] a sign for them that We bear their offspring [over the seas] in laden ships,
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:42: and [that] We create for them things of a similar kind, on which they may embark [in their travels];
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:43: and [that,] if such be Our will, We may cause them to drown, with none to respond to their cry for help: and [then] they cannot be saved,
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:44: unless it be by an act of mercy from Us and a grant of life for a [further span of] time.
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:45: And [yet,] when they are told, "Beware of [God’s insight into] all that lies open before you and all that is hidden from you, so that you might be graced with His mercy," [most men choose to remain deaf;]
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:46: and no message of their Sustainer’s messages ever reaches them without their turning away from it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:47: Thus, when they are told, "Spend on others out of what God has provided for you as sustenance," those who are bent on denying the truth say unto those who believe, "Shall we feed anyone whom, if [your] God had so willed, He could have fed [Himself]? Clearly, you are but lost in error!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:48: And they add, "When is this promise [of resurrection] to be fulfilled? [Answer this] if you are men of truth!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:49: [And they are unaware that] nothing awaits them beyond a single blast [of God’s punishment], which will overtake them while they are still arguing [against resurrection]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:50: and so [sudden will be their end that] no testament will they be able to make, nor to their own people will they return!
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:51: And [then] the trumpet [of resurrection] will be blown – and lo! out of their graves towards their Sustainer will they all rush forth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:52: They will say: "Oh, woe unto us! Who has roused us from our sleep [of death]?" [Whereupon they will be told:] "This is what the Most Gracious has promised! And His message-bearers spoke the truth!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:53: Nothing will there have been but one single blast – and lo! before Us will all of them be arraigned [and be told]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:54: "Today, then, no human being shall be wronged in the least, nor shall you be requited for aught but what you were doing [on earth].
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:55: "Behold, those who are destined for paradise shall today have joy in whatever they do:
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:56: in happiness will they and their spouses on couches recline;
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:57: [only] delight will there be for them, and theirs shall be all that they could ask for:
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:58: peace and fulfilment through the word of a Sustainer who dispenses all grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:59: "But stand aside today, O you who were lost in sin!
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:60: Did I not enjoin on you, O you children of Adam, that you should not worship Satan – since, verily, he is your open foe –
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:61: and that you should worship Me [alone]? This would have been a straight way!
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:62: And [as far Satan –] he had already led astray a great many of you: could you not, then, use your reason?
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:63: "This, then, is the hell of which you were warned again and again:
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:64: endure it today as an outcome of your persistent denial of the truth!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:65: On that Day We shall set a seal on their mouths – but their hands will speak unto Us, and their feet will bear witness to whatever they have earned [in life].
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:66: NOW HAD IT BEEN Our will [that men should not be able to discern between right and wrong], We could surely have deprived them of their sight, so that they would stray forever from the [right] way: for how could they have had insight [into what is true]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:67: And had it been Our will [that they should not be free to choose between right and wrong], We could surely have given them a different nature [and created them as beings rooted] in their places, so that they would not be able to move forward, and could not turn back.
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:68: But [let them always remember that] if We lengthen a human being’s days, We also cause him to decline in his powers [when he grows old]: will they not, then, use their reason?
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:69: AND [thus it is:] We have not imparted to this [Prophet the gift of] poetry, nor would [poetry] have suited this [message]: it is but a reminder and a [divine] discourse, clear in itself and clearly showing the truth,
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:70: to the end that it may warn everyone who is alive [of heart], and that the word [of God] may bear witness against all who deny the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:71: Are they, then, not aware that it is for them that We have created, among all the things which Our hands have wrought, the domestic animals of which they are [now] masters? –
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:72: and that We have subjected them to men’s will, so that some of them they may use for riding and of some they may eat,
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:73: and may have [yet other] benefits from them, and [milk] to drink? Will they not, then, be grateful?
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:74: But [nay,] they take to worshipping deities other than God, [hoping] to be succoured [by them, and not knowing that]
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:75: they are unable to succour their devotees, even though to them they may [appear to] be hosts drawn up [for succour].
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:76: However, be not grieved by the sayings of those [who deny the truth]: verily, We know all that they keep secret as well as all that they bring into the open.
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:77: IS MAN, then, not aware that it is We who create him out of a [mere] drop of sperm – whereupon, lo! he shows himself endowed with the power to think and to argue?
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:78: And [now] he [argues about Us, and] thinks of Us in terms of comparison, and is oblivious of how he himself was created! [And so] he says, "Who could give life to bones that have crumbled to dust?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:79: Say: "He who brought them into being in the first instance will give them life [once again], seeing that He has full knowledge of every act of creation:
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:80: He who produces for you fire out of the green tree, so that, lo! you kindle [your fires] therewith."
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:81: Is, then, He who has created the heavens and the earth not able to create [anew] the like of those [who have died]? Yea, indeed – for He alone is the all-knowing Creator:
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:82: His Being alone is such that when He wills a thing to be, He but says unto it, "Be" – and it is.
Muhammad Asad.verse 36:83: Limitless, then, in His glory is He in whose hand rests the mighty dominion over all things; and unto Him you all will be brought back!

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:2: By the Qur’ān, that is full of wisdom,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:3: You are truly one of the messengers of Allah,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:4: (and you are) on a straight path,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:5: (this Qur’ān being) a revelation from the All- Mighty, the Very-Merciful,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:6: so that you may warn a people whose fathers were not warned, and hence, they are unaware.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:7: The word has indeed come true about most of them, so they will not believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:8: We have placed iron collars on their necks, so they are reaching up to their chins, and their heads are forced to remain upwards.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:9: And We have placed a barrier in front of them and a barrier behind them, and (thus) they are encircled by Us; so they do not see.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:10: It is all equal for them whether you warn them or do not warn them, they will not believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:11: You can (usefully) warn only the one who follows the advice and fears the RaHmān (the All-Merciful Allah) without seeing (Him). So give him the good news of forgiveness and of a noble reward.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:12: Surely We will give new life to the dead, and We are recording whatever (deeds) they send before them and whatever effects they leave behind. Every thing is fully computed by Us in a manifest book of record.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:13: Cite to them the example of the People of the Town, when the messengers came to it,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:14: when We sent to them two (apostles), and they rejected both of them, so We confirmed them with a third one. So they said, “We are sent to you.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:15: They (the people of the Town) said, “You are no more than human beings like us, and the RaHmān (the All-Merciful Allah) has not sent down any thing. You are but telling a lie.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:16: They (the messengers) said, “Our Lord knows that we are undoubtedly sent to you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:17: Our obligation is no more than to convey the message clearly.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:18: They (the People of the Town) said, “We take you as a bad omen for us. If you do not desist, we will certainly stone you and you will be afflicted by a painful punishment from us.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:19: They said, “Your bad omen is with yourselves. (Do you take it as bad omen) if you are given a good counsel? Rather, you are a people who cross all limits.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:20: And there came a man rushing from the farthest part of the city. He said, “O my people, follow the messengers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:21: Follow those who do not claim any reward from you, and who are on the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:22: What excuse do I have if I do not worship the One who has created me and to whom you will be returned?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:23: Shall I adopt those gods besides Him whose intercession, if RaHmān (the All-Merciful Allah) intends to do harm to me, cannot help me in the least, nor can they come to my rescue?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:24: In that case, I will be in open error indeed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:25: Undoubtedly I have believed in your Lord; so listen to me.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:26: (Thereafter when his people killed him,) it was said to him, “Enter the Paradise”. He said, “Would that my people knew
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:27: how my Lord has forgiven me and placed me among the honoured ones!”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:28: And We did not send down to his people any army from the heavens after him, nor were We (in need) to send down.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:29: It was no more than a single Cry, and in no time they were extinguished.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:30: Alas for the slaves (of Allah)! No messenger came to them, but they have been mocking at him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:31: Did they not see how many generations We have destroyed before them who will not come back to them?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:32: All of them are but to be assembled together (and) to be arraigned before Us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:33: And a sign for them is the dead land. We gave it life and brought forth grain from it; so from it they eat.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:34: And We have placed gardens of date-palms and grapes, and caused springs to gush forth therein,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:35: so that they may eat fruits thereof, while it was not made by their hands. Would they not then offer gratitude?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:36: Pure (from every fault) is the One who has created all the pairs of whatever the earth grows and of the humans themselves and of that which they do not know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:37: And a sign for them is the night. We strip (the cover of) the day from it, and they are suddenly in darkness.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:38: And the sun is quickly proceeding towards its destination. That is the designing of the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:39: And for the moon We have appointed measured phases, until it turned (pale, curved and fine) like an old branch of date palm.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:40: Neither it is for the sun to overtake the moon, nor can the night outpace the day. Each one is floating in an orbit.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:41: And it is a sign for them that We boarded their children in the loaded ship,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:42: and created for them things similar to it on which they ride.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:43: And if We so will, We can drown them; then no one will respond to their cry, nor will they be rescued,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:44: unless there be mercy from Us, and (unless) We let them enjoy for a while.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:45: And (they pay no heed) when it is said to them, “Save yourselves from that (punishment) which is before you (in this world) and that which will come after you (die), so that you may receive mercy”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:46: There comes to them no sign from the signs of your Lord, but they turn averse to it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:47: And when it is said to them, “Spend (to the needy) from the provision Allah has given to you”, the disbelievers say to the believers, “Shall we feed those whom Allah could have fed, if Allah so willed? You are but in open error.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:48: And they say, “When will this promise come true, if you are truthful?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:49: They are looking for nothing but for a single Cry that will seize them when they will be quarrelling.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:50: So they will not be able to make a bequest, nor will they return to their household.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:51: And the Horn will be blown, and suddenly they will be rushing from their graves towards their Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:52: They will say, “Woe to us! Who has raised us from our sleeping place? “This is what RaHmān (the All-Merciful Allah) had promised, and the messengers had told the truth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:53: It will be no more than a single Cry, and in no time they will all be arraigned before Us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:54: Then, nobody will be subjected to injustice in the least, and you will not be recompensed but for what you used to do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:55: The people of the Paradise are engaged today in (their) activities, happily enjoying (them).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:56: They and their spouses are in pleasant shades, reclining on couches.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:57: For them there are fruits, and for them there is whatever they ask for.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:58: “Salām ”(Peace upon you) is the word (they receive) from Merciful Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:59: And (it will be said to the infidels,) “Get apart (from the believers) today O the guilty ones.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:60: Did I not direct you, O children of ’Ādam (Adam), that you must not worship the Satan, (because) he is an open enemy for you,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:61: and that you must worship Me, (because) this is the straight path?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:62: He had misguided lot many people from among you. So, did you not have sense?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:63: (Now) this is the Jahannam of which you were consistently warned.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:64: Enter it today, because you have been persistently denying (the truth).”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:65: Today We will set a seal on their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their legs will bear witness about what they used to do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:66: If We so will, We would wipe out their eyes (right here in this world), and they would be racing towards the way, but how would they see?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:67: And If We so will, We would disfigure them at their places, and they would not be able to move, nor would they return.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:68: And whomsoever We give long life, we reverse him in creation. Then, do they have no sense?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:69: We did not teach him (the Holy Prophet) poetry, and it is not proper for him. It is nothing (of that sort,) but (it is) an advice and a readable book that explains (the Truth),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:70: so that it may warn him who is alive (to listen to the truth), and so that the word may prove true against the disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:71: Did they not see that We have created for them cattle, among things made (directly) by Our hands, and then they become their owners?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:72: And We have brought them under their control, so as some of them are their means of transport, and some of them they eat.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:73: And for them there are (other) benefits in them and things to drink. So, would they not be grateful?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:74: They have adopted gods other than Allah, so that they may be helped (by them).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:75: They cannot help them, rather they (the disbelievers themselves) are (like) an army brought forth for (protecting) them (the so-called co-gods)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:76: So, their remarks must not grieve you. Surely We know what they conceal and what they disclose.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:77: Did man not see that We have created him from a drop of semen? Then suddenly he stood as an open adversary (to Us).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:78: He has set up an argument about Us and forgot his creation. He said, “Who will give life to the bones when they are decayed?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:79: Say, “These will be revived by the same One who had created them for the first time, and who is fully aware of every creation,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:80: - the One who created for you fire from the green tree, and in no time you kindle from it.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:81: Is it that the One who has created the heavens and the earth has no power to create ones like them? Why not? He is the Supreme Creator, the All-Knowing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:82: His practice, when He intends to do something, is no more than He says, “Be”, and it comes to be.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 36:83: So, pure (from every fault) is the One in whose hand is the dominion of all things. And towards Him you are to be returned.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:3: you are indeed of those sent [by God],
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:5: A revelation from the Mighty, the Merciful,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:6: that you may warn a people whose fathers were not warned, so they are oblivious.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:7: The word has already proved true for most of them, for they will not believe.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:8: Indeed We have put fetters around their necks, such that they are up to the chins so that their heads are upturned.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:9: And We have set before them a barrier and behind them a barrier; so We have covered them, so they do not see.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:10: And it is the same to them whether you warn them or do not warn them, they will not believe.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:11: You can only warn him who follows the Remembrance, and fears the Compassionate One in secret; so give him the good tidings of forgiveness and a noble reward.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:12: Truly it is We Who bring the dead to life, and record what they have sent ahead and their vestiges. And everything We have numbered in a clear register.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:13: And strike for them as a similitude the inhabitants of the town, when the messengers came to it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:14: When We sent to them two men, and they denied them both, so We reinforced [them] with a third, and they said, ‘We have indeed been sent to you [by God]’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:15: They said, ‘You are nothing but humans like us, and the Compassionate One has revealed nothing. You are only lying!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:16: They said, ‘Our Lord knows that we have indeed been sent to you [by Him]!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:17: And our duty is only to communicate in clear terms’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:18: They said, ‘We augur ill of you. If you do not desist, we will surely stone you and there shall befall you, at our hands, a painful chastisement’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:19: They said, ‘May your augury of ill be with you! What! [Even] if [it be that] you are being reminded? Nay, but you are a profligate people!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:20: And there came a man from the furthest part of the city, hastening. He said, ‘O my people, follow the messengers!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:21: Follow them who do not ask you for any reward and who are rightly guided.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:22: And why should I not worship Him Who originated me and to Whom you shall be returned?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:23: Shall I take besides Him [other] gods, whose intercession, if the Compassionate One should wish me any harm, will not avail me in any way, nor will they [be able to] save me?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:24: Truly then I would be in manifest error.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:25: Lo! I believe in your Lord. So listen to me!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:26: It was said: ‘Enter Paradise!’ He said, ‘O would that my people knew.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:27: with what [munificence] my Lord has forgiven me and made me of the honoured ones!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:28: And We did not send down on his people after him any host from the heaven, nor do We [ever] send down.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:29: It was but one Cry and lo! they were extinguished.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:30: Ah, the anguish for servants, never did a messenger come to them but that they mocked him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:31: Have they not seen, how many generations We have destroyed before them, [how] that they never return?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:32: And indeed every one of them will be gathered before Us, arraigned.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:33: And a sign for them is the dead earth which We revive and out of which We bring forth grain so that they eat thereof;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:34: and We have placed therein gardens of date-palms and vines, and We have caused springs to gush forth therein,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:35: that they might eat of its fruits; but it was not their hands that made it. Will they not then give thanks?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:36: Glory be to Him Who created all the pairs of what the earth produces, and of themselves, and of what they do not know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:37: And a sign for them is the night, from which We strip the day and, behold, they find themselves in darkness.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:38: And the sun [which] runs to its resting-place. That is the ordaining of the Mighty, the Knower.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:39: And the moon We have determined it [to run] in phases until it returns, like an aged palm-bough.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:40: It does not behove the sun to catch up with the moon, nor may the night outrun the day, and each [of these] is in an orbit, swimming.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:41: And a sign for them is that We carried their seed in the laden Ark,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:42: and We have created for them the like of it in which they ride.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:43: And if We will, We drown them, whereat they have no one to call to, nor are they rescued,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:44: except by a mercy from Us and for an enjoyment until some time.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:45: And when it is said to them, ‘Beware of that which is before you, and that which is behind you that perhaps you might find mercy’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:46: And never did a sign of the signs of their Lord come to them, but that they turned away from it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:47: And when it is said to them, ‘Expend of what God has provided you’, those who disbelieve say to those who believe: ‘Are we to feed those whom, if God willed, He would feed? You are only in manifest error!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:48: And they say, ‘When will this promise be [fulfilled], if you are being truthful?’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:49: They await but a single Cry that will seize them while they are disputing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:50: Then they will not be able to make any testament, nor will they return to their folk.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:51: And the Trumpet is blown; and lo! they will be scrambling out of their graves towards their Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:52: They will say, ‘O woe to us! Who has raised us from our place of sleep? This is that which the Compassionate One had promised and the messengers had spoken the truth’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:53: It is but a single Cry, and, behold, they will all be arraigned before Us!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:54: So today no soul shall be wronged in any way, and you shall not be requited, except what you used to do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:55: Indeed today the inhabitants of Paradise are busy rejoicing;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:56: they and their spouses, beneath the shade, reclining upon couches.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:57: They have fruits therein and they have whatever they call for.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:58: “Peace!” — the word from a Lord [Who is] Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:59: ‘And Stand apart, O you sinners, on this day!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:60: Did I not charge you O children of Adam that you should not worship Satan; truly he is a manifest enemy to you,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:61: and that [you should] worship Me — that is the straight path?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:62: For verily he has led astray from among you many a creature. Did you not use to comprehend?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:63: This is Hell, which you were promised!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:64: Burn therein today [as chastisement] for that which you used to reject!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:65: Today We shall seal up their mouths, and their hands shall speak to Us, and their feet shall bear witness concerning what they used to earn.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:66: And had We willed We would have obliterated their eyesight, then they [would have tried to] advance towards the path, but how would they have seen?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:67: And had We willed We would have transformed them in their place; then they would have neither been able to go ahead nor to return.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:68: And whomever We give long life, We cause him to regress in creation. Will they then not understand?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:69: And We did not teach him poetry, nor is it seemly for him. It is just Remembrance and a Qur’ān that clarifies,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:70: that he may warn whoever is alive, and that the Word may be fulfilled against the disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:71: Or, have they not seen that We have created for them of what Our hands worked cattle, so that they are their owners?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:72: And We have subdued these [cattle] for them, so that some of them provide rides for them and some of them they eat.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:73: And there are other benefits for them therein and drinks. Will they not then give thanks?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:74: And they have taken besides God [other] gods that perhaps they might be helped.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:75: They cannot help them and they are their host, ever-present.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:76: So do not be grieved by their remarks. Assuredly We know what they conceal and what they proclaim.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:77: Or has man not seen that We created him from a drop. Then lo! he is an open adversary.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:78: And he strikes for Us a similitude and forgets [the manner of] his creation; he says, ‘Who will revive the bones when they are rot?’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:79: Say: ‘He will revive them Who originated them the first time, and He is Knower of all creation,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:80: He Who has made for you fire from the green tree, and, behold, from it you kindle’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:81: Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like of them? And He is the Creator, the Knower.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:82: His command when He wills a thing, is just to say to it ‘Be’, and it is.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 36:83: So glory be to Him in Whose hand is the dominion of all things and to Whom you will be returned.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:1: Ya-Sin. (Only Allah and the Messenger [blessings and peace be upon him] know the real meaning.)
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:2: By the Qur’an, full of wisdom,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:3: You are indeed one of the Messengers,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:5: This is revealed by the Almighty, Ever-Merciful,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:6: That you may warn the people whose fathers were (also) not warned. So they are careless and neglectful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:7: In fact, Our command has proved true against most of them. So they will not believe.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:8: Surely, We have put iron collars round their necks reaching their chins. So they have raised their heads up.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:9: And We have set a barrier before them and a barrier behind them, and We have cast a veil over their eyes so they do not see anything.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:10: And it is all the same for them whether you warn or do not warn them, they will not believe.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:11: You can only warn the one who follows the direction and guidance and fears the Most Kind (Lord) unseen. So give him the good news of forgiveness and a reward of great honour.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:12: Surely, We alone raise the dead to life. And We are writing down (the deeds) which they have sent forward and their effects (that are left behind). And We have encompassed everything in the illumining Book (al-Lawh al-Mahfuz).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:13: And narrate to them the (legendary) example of the people of a city (Antioch—an ancient city in Northern Syria) when there came to them some Messengers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:14: When (at first) We sent to them two Messengers, they rejected them both. Then We reinforced (them) with a third (Messenger). Then the three of them said: ‘Surely, we have been sent to you.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:15: (The people of the city) said: ‘You are but human beings like us, and the Most Kind (Lord) has not sent down anything. You are only lying.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:16: (The Messengers) said: ‘Surely, our Lord knows that we have been sent to you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:17: And there is nothing binding upon us except to communicate the message clearly.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:18: (The people of the city) said: ‘An evil omen has reached us from you. If you do not desist, we shall certainly stone you, and you will definitely suffer an agonizing punishment at our hands.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:19: (The Messengers) said: ‘Your evil omen is with you. Is it an evil omen that you are admonished? Nay, but you are a people who exceed limits.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:20: And a person came running from the farthest end of the city. He said: ‘O my people, follow the Messengers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:21: Follow those who do not ask from you any compensation and who are rightly guided.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:22: And what is the matter with me that I should not worship Him Who has created me and to Him (all of) you will be returned?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:23: Should I take such gods apart from Him (Allah) that if the Most Kind (Lord) intends to do me any harm, their intercession would not bring me any benefit, nor would they be able to rescue me?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:24: Then, certainly, I would be in open error.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:25: Surely, I have believed in your Lord, so listen to me (attentively).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:26: (The disbelievers martyred him; then it) was said (to him): ‘(Come,) enter Paradise.’ He said: ‘Alas! Would that my people knew,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:27: That my Lord has forgiven me, and put me amongst the honoured and near ones.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:28: And, after him, We did not send any army (of angels) from the heaven to his people, nor were We to send down (angels to destroy them).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:29: (Their torment) was nothing but a Mighty Blast, and there were they extinguished (dead like charred coal).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:30: Ah! Woe to (these) servants! Never did a Messenger come to them but they used to mock him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:31: Have they not seen how many communities We destroyed before them, and that now they will not return to them,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:32: But that all of them will be brought before Our presence?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:33: And a sign for them is the dead earth to which We gave life, and We brought forth from it (grain); then they eat of it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:34: And We produced in it gardens of date-palms and grapes, and also caused some springs as well to gush forth in it,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:35: So that they may eat of its fruits. And it is not their hands that made it. Do they not thank (even) then?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:36: Glory be to Him Who created everything in pairs of those the earth grows and of themselves as well and, (moreover,) of the things they do not know.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:37: And (also) a sign for them is the night: (how) We draw the day out from it! So then they are left in darkness!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:38: And the sun is constantly rotating (non-stop) for its appointed destination. It is a measure fixed by the Almighty, All-Knowing (Lord).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:39: And We have also appointed stages (of motion and rotation) of the moon till (its appearance to the dwellers of the earth wanes to) the semblance of an old dry branch of a palm-tree.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:40: Neither can the sun (deviate from its orbit and) overtake the moon, nor can the night precede the day, and all (the stars and planets) are moving in their respective orbits.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:41: And a sign for them is (also) that We boarded their fathers (the Children of Adam) into the laden Ark of (Nuh [Noah] and saved them).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:42: And like this (Ark) We made for them (many other means of transport) which they ride.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:43: And if We intend, We drown them. Then there will not be any to respond to their cry, nor will they be saved anyway,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:44: Except for Our mercy and (this) provision is for an appointed term.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:45: And (recall) when it is said to them: ‘Fear that (torment) which is before you and which is behind you so that you may be shown mercy.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:46: And not a sign of the signs of their Lord comes to them but they turn away from it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:47: And when it is said to them: ‘Spend (in the way of Allah) of what Allah has given you,’ the disbelievers say to the believers: ‘Shall we feed that (poor) man whom, if Allah so willed, He would feed (Himself)?’ You are but (caught) in clear error.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:48: And they say: ‘When will this promise (of the Last Hour) be fulfilled if you are truthful?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:49: They are simply waiting for a Mighty Blast which will seize them (all of a sudden), and they will be disputing amongst themselves.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:50: Then they will not be able to make a will or to return to their families.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:51: And (when) the Trumpet will be blown (again) they will come out of the graves at once and run towards their Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:52: (Seeing the horrors of the Hour of Resurrection,) they will say: ‘Ah, woe to us! Who has raised us from our sleeping places? This (coming back to life) is the same that the Most Kind (Lord) promised and the Messengers spoke the truth.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:53: This will only be a Mighty Blast. Then all of them will be brought to Our presence straight away.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:54: So Today no soul will be wronged in the least. Nor will you be rewarded except for the deeds you used to do.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:55: Surely, the residents of Paradise will be rejoicing Today (in their) favourite pastime pursuits (like spiritual visits, entertainments, sessions of hymns and eulogies).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:56: They and their wives will be reclining on raised couches under the deep, calming shades.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:57: There they will be provided with fruits (of every kind) and will find (available) everything they will solicit.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:58: ‘Peace (be upon you)!’ (This) greeting will be conveyed (to them) from the Ever-Merciful Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:59: ‘And, O evildoers, get aside (from the righteous) this Day.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:60: O Children of Adam! Did I not take this covenant from you not to worship Satan; no doubt he is your open enemy;
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:61: And that you keep worshipping Me alone? That is the straight path.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:62: And surely, he led great many of you astray, so had you not any wisdom?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:63: This is the same Hell that was being promised to you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:64: Enter this Hell Today, for you kept disbelieving.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:65: Today We shall seal their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will bear witness to the deeds which they used to earn.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:66: And if We had so willed, We would have obliterated the very marks of their eyes. Then if they would have run on the path, how could they have seen?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:67: And if We had so intended, We would have defaced them in their places. Then they would have power neither to go forward nor to turn back.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:68: And someone whom We give long life, We cause him to degenerate (towards childhood and debility) in strength and disposition. So, do they not have sense?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:69: And We have not taught him (the Holy Messenger [blessings and peace be upon him]) composing poetry, nor does it befit his dignity. This (Book) is but direction and guidance and the illumining Qur’an,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:70: So that it may warn the one who is alive, and the word of judgment may be proved against the disbelievers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:71: Have they not seen that We created for them cattle out of the (creation) We made with Our Mighty Hand, so they are their owners?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:72: And We subjected those (cattle) to them. So some of them are their riding animals and they eat some of them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:73: And there are other benefits and drinks in them as well for them. Then why do they not give thanks?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:74: And they have made idols their gods other than Allah with the hope that they will be helped.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:75: These idols are incapable of helping them. And these (disbelievers and polytheists) will be an army of these (idols) that will be brought (into Hell together).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:76: So let not what they utter hurt you. Surely, We know whatever they hide and whatever they make public.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:77: Has man not seen that We have created him from a sperm drop? Even then, he has become an open adversary.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:78: And he (himself) puts forth examples for Us and has forgotten (the truth of) his creation. He says: ‘Who will give life to bones when they will have been decomposed?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:79: Say: ‘He Who created them the first time will give them life. And He knows best every creation;
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:80: He Who produces fire for you out of the green tree so now you kindle fire with the same!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:81: And does He Who created the heavens and the earth not have the power to create the like of them (again)?’ Yes indeed! And He is the Supreme Creator, the All-Knowing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:82: His command (of creation) is only that when He intends (to create) something, He says to it: ‘Be,’ so it instantly becomes (existent or visible and continues becoming).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 36:83: So, Glory be to Him in Whose Hand (i.e., power and control) is the sovereignty over everything and to Him you will be returned.

null.verse 36:3: olethan totisesti yksi sananjulistajista
null.verse 36:5: Tässä on ilmoitus mahtavalta, laupiaalta,
null.verse 36:6: jotta voisit varoittaa kansaa, jonka esi-isiä ei varoitettu ja joka on välinpitämätön.
null.verse 36:7: Sana on käynyt todeksi, että enin osa heistä on uskon hylännyt.
null.verse 36:8: Kahleet Me olemme totisesti kietonut heidän kaulansa ympäri aina heidän leukansa korkeudelle, niin että heidän päänsä ovat pystyyn pönkitetyt.
null.verse 36:9: Ja Me olemme asettanut esteen heidän eteensä ja esteen heidän taaksensa sekä heittänyt verhon heidän ylitsensä peittäen heidän näkönsä.
null.verse 36:10: Yhdentekevää on heille varoitatko heitä vai et, sillä he eivät usko.
null.verse 36:11: Varoittaa voi vain sitä, joka nuhteesta vaarin ottaa ja sisimmässään Armahtajaa pelkää; sellaiselle julista anteeksiantoa ja suurta palkintoa.
null.verse 36:12: Totisesti Me herätämme kuolleet eloon ja pidämme kirjaa kaikista heidän teoistaan, jopa heidän jalkojensa jäljistäkin; ja kaiken tämän olemme selvästi kirjoittanut.
null.verse 36:13: Esitä heille vertaus sen kaupungin asukkaista, johon sanansaattajamme saapuivat.
null.verse 36:14: Kun Me lähetimme kaksi heidän luoksensa, torjuivat he pois nämä, ja kun Me vahvistimme heitä kolmannella ja kaikki vakuuttivat: »Me olemme totisesti (Jumalan) julistajia»,
null.verse 36:15: Niin he sanoivat: »Ette ole muuta kuin kuolevaisia, kuten me itsekin, eikä hyvä Jumala ole mitään ilmoitustaan teille uskonut; te vain valehtelette.»
null.verse 36:16: Nämä vastasivat: »Herramme tietää, että varmasti olemme Hänen julistuksensa tuojia teille,
null.verse 36:17: eikä meillä ole muuta mielessämme kuin toimittaa perille selvä viestimme.»
null.verse 36:18: He sanoivat: »Me aavistamme teidän tulostanne koituvan meille pahaa; ellette lakkaa, me kivitämme teidät ja tuotamme teille tuskallisen lopun.»
null.verse 36:19: Nämä selittivät: »Itsestänne teistä kohtalonne johtuu eikä siitä, että me teitä varoitamme. Totisesti olette mieletöntä väkeä.»
null.verse 36:20: Silloin riensi sinne juosten eräs mies ja huusi: »Kansa, ota vaari viestintuojista;
null.verse 36:21: seuratkaa sitä, joka ei pyydä palkkiota teiltä, sillä lähettiläät ovat oikean tien vaeltajia.
